characteristics: \b commander\b0, \b leader\b0, \b Corellian\b0, Rogue Squadron pilot
gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Rogue 3, it is maneuver +2 and your Force drains here are +1. While piloting a T-47, Wedge draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and, if opponent draws more than one battle destiny here, may cancel one.
lore: Promoted to commander for his heroism in the Battle of Yavin. \b Leader\b0  in charge of training new pilots assigned to Echo Base. Piloted Rogue 3 in the battle of Hoth.
name: Commander Wedge Antilles (V)

gametext: During battle, if present at a site with a stormtrooper (or Rebel leader), may add one destiny to total power only. Once per turn, may subtract 1 from a destiny draw of an opponent's Interrupt or weapon targeting a non-Jedi Rebel here.
lore: Corellian Corvette trooper Ensign Chad Hilse, an Alderaanian, typifies the loyal Rebel volunteers dedicated to defeating the Empire. Trained in starship and ground combat.
name: Ensign Chad Hilse

gametext: Permanent pilots are (*]Han and (*]Chewie, who provide total ability of 5. Attempts here to "blow away" any Death Star are +2. Immune to Come With Me, Lateral Damage, Life Debt, and attrition < 6.
lore: Although temperamental, this trusty hunk of junk always seems to perform for its proud owner and his Wookiee co-pilot when needed the most.
name: Han, Chewie, And The Falcon (V)

gametext: Deploy on a Rebel leader. Opponent may not cancel or reduce Force drains at same battleground. If on Leia, she is a general, power +2, and, once per turn, may cancel the immunity to attrition of a character (or game text of a [Jabba's Palace] alien) here for remainder of turn.
lore: The face that launched a thousand starships.
name: Leia Of Alderaan (V)

gametext: Deploy on a Rebel (or Resistance) pilot. Any starfighter or vehicle character pilots is power +2. If present at a site, may use 1 Force to place this device in Used Pile. Once per game, if character is piloting in battle, may cancel a non-[Immune to Sense] Interrupt.
lore: Pilot fatigues feature digital technology which can be customized for particular starfighters. Increases interface efficiency with a newly assigned craft.
name: Rebel Flight Suit (V)

gametext: May add 4 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. When deployed, may deploy a non-[Maintenance] Rebel aboard from your Lost Pile.
lore: Nebulon-B frigate used as a mobile medical facility. Extra cargo space and weapon batteries have been modified to allow for more armor and more recovery areas.
name: Redemption (V)

gametext: May add 1 pilot and 5 passengers. Permanent pilot is (*]Ric, who provides ability of 3. R2-D2 deploys -2 aboard. While We'll Need A New One on table, adds one battle destiny. Immune to attrition < 5.
lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.
name: Ric In Queen's Royal Starship

dark_side_text: Unless Vader or your trooper here, Force drain -1 here (if both here, Force drain +1 instead).
gametext: Anakin, Beru and Owen move to or from here for free when using landspeed.   Unless Vader or your trooper here, Force drain -1 here (if both here, Force drain +1 instead).
light_side_text: Anakin, Beru and Owen move to or from here for free when using landspeed
name: Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm (V)

gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots \ul May reveal from hand to steal an unpiloted TIE from opponent's Lost Pile and deploy both simultaneously.\ul0  Any snub fighter he pilots is maneuver +1 and immune to attrition < 4.
lore: \b Spy\b0  fighting for the memory of his homeworld of Alderaan. Rogue Squadron pilot. Volunteered to fly an A-wing at the Battle of Endor. Former TIE fighter pilot.
name: Tycho Celchu (V)

gametext: May deploy as a 'react.' Permanent pilot is (*]Tycho, who provides ability of 2 and adds 3 to his Epic Event destiny draws. During battle, may target a starfighter; target's immunity to attrition is canceled.
lore: Flown by Tycho Celchu at the Battle of Endor. Modified canopy improves pilot vision in tight confines. Assigned to fly top cover for \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0.
name: Tycho In Green Squadron 3

gametext: To play this Interrupt, you must first place a card stacked on Jabba's Trophies in owner's Lost Pile.\par USED: Draw top card of Reserve Deck.\par LOST: Cancel an attempt to use a weapon to target your alien. OR Cancel Sense.
lore: Jabba's minions could be expected to be sacrificed to save the Hutt, to destroy one of the Hutts enemies or to provide the Hutt and his minions with a good laugh.
name: A Trophy Sacrificed

gametext: Deploy on your non-[Maintenance] bounty hunter. If on Boba Fett, once per game, during your move phase, may use 2 Force to relocate him (with any captive he is escorting) to a site. May target a character or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value.
lore: Sawed off BlasTech EE-3 blaster rifle. Although its barrel is a few centimeters under the legal limit, no one has lived to file an official complaint.
name: Boba Fett's Blaster Rifle (V)

gametext: Permanent pilot is (*]Jonus, who provides ability of 2. This starship's missile weapon destiny draws are +1. If at a system you control, your total power at related sites is +1.
lore: TIE bomber repaired after being struck by an asteroid in the Anoat system. Stationed aboard second Death Star battle station.
name: Captain Jonus In Scimitar 2

gametext: Scavenger. Once per turn, if your droid just deployed to same site, may peek at the top two cards of your Reserve Deck (may take one into hand). During battle here, may forfeit Dathcha (or one non-[Permanet Weapon] droid) to Used Pile (using forfeit value = 3).
lore: Jawa adventurer and trader. Famous for taunting a krayt dragon and escaping to tell the tale. Wants to leave Tatooine to explore the galaxy.
name: Dathcha (V)

characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b Corellian\b0, \b assassin\b0
gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Characters about to be 'hit' by Dengar may be captured instead. If Dengar is about to be 'hit' while escorting a captive, captive is hit instead.  If Dengar just seized a Rebel or a smuggler, opponent loses 1 Force (2 if Han).
lore: Corellian \b bounty hunter\b0. Assassin trained by the Empire. Has reflex-enhancing cyber implants. Gravely injured during a swoop race in the crystal swamp of Agrilat. Blames Han Solo.
name: Dengar (V)

gametext: Never deploys or moves (even if carried) to a site opponent occupies. Once during your turn, may peek at the top three cards of your Reserve Deck; place one in Used Pile, one in Lost Pile, and take one into hand. Immune to attrition.
lore: From his throne room aboard the second Death Star, Emperor Palpatine monitors activity throughout the galaxy.\b Leader\b0 .
name: Emperor Palpatine, Foreseer

gametext: Draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.  While at Audience Chamber (or stacked on your Objective), your other Weequays are deploy -1, power +1, and forfeit +2. Once per game, may deploy Aurra Sing, Slave I, or a Kowakian from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Weequay \b gangster\b0 , \b leader\b0 , and \b pirate\b0 .
name: Hondo Ohnaka

gametext: Deploy on table. [Death Star II] Vader is deploy = 6. Once per turn, may deploy Vader's Lightsaber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle (or lose 1 Force to deploy it from Lost Pile). Whenever a lightsaber swung by Vader 'hits' a character, opponent loses 1 Force. Immune to NOOOOOOOOOOOO!. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: "Search your feelings, you know it to be true."
name: I Am Your Father (V)

gametext: \b Immediately\b0  'thaw' Luke (Luke is a non-frozen captive escorted by Vader).\par \b While\b0   this side up, subtracts 3 from attempts to cross Luke over (even while a captive).\par \b Place\b0  out of play if released or about to leave table.
name: Luke Skywalker, The Emperor's Prize

gametext: \ul Luke Skywalker, The Emperor's Prize is a Dark Side card and does not count toward your deck limit. Reveal to opponent when deploying your Starting Effect.\par Deploys to Death Star II: Throne Room only at start of game as a frozen captive if Bring Him Before Me on table and Your Destiny is suspended; otherwise place out of play.\ul  \par \b For\b0  remainder of game, may not be placed in Reserve Deck. Luke Skywalker, The Emperor's Prize is a persona of Luke only while on table.\par \b While\b0  this side up, Bring Him Before Me may not flip. May not be escorted. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Vader present and not escorting a captive.\par \b Place\b0  out of play if released or about to leave table.
name: Luke Skywalker, The Emperor's Prize (Frozen)

gametext: Deploy on an Imperial leader. Opponent may not cancel or reduce Force drains at same battleground. Once per game, may place this Effect out of play to retrieve Vader.
lore: Though reluctant to leave Coruscant, Emperor Palpatine occasionally finds it necessary to personally put lagging Imperial operations back on schedule.
name: Overseeing It Personally (V)

gametext: USED: Move a trooper as a 'react' to a battle where you have a leader. OR During any draw phase, place a card from hand under your Used Pile to take any one card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle. LOST: During a battle at a site, cancel Keep Your Eyes Open.
lore: In a military situation, on a regional or galactic scale, commands sometimes get misinterpreted. A local commander giving orders is far more reliable.
name: Point Man (V)

gametext: If Emperor on table, destiny +2 when drawn for destiny. While at Death Star II: Throne Room, your total battle destiny during battles anywhere is +X, where X = number of Dark Jedi here or cards stacked on Insignificant Rebellion.
lore: Imperial council member. Senior political advisor to Emperor Palpatine. Never speaks. Like his master, shows remarkable patience and wisdom.
name: Sim Aloo (V)

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Smuggler. While present at a pit, adds 1 to your Force drains here. Unless 'hit' (or Gamall Wironicc here), your other characters here may not be targeted by lightsabers. May not target Luke with weapons.
lore: Assigned by Jabba to work with Hermi Odle. Former technician for the Empire. Developed a method to remotely control seekers. Plotting to kill Jabba.
name: Velken Tezeri (V)
